column4: Can you update one ubuntu install from another box over a network?
the computer with the packages needs to be setup as a repository -- you can use apt-proxy or apt-mirror .. i prefer the former
i dont think that is possible out of the box (you could have something (a script perhaps) scan the contents of the directory and change permissions/ownership as and when needed)
and sepheebear, or oes it have something to do with the unix users' unmask?
in anycase, this isnt the right way to setup samba .. yes check out the umask directive for samba as per samba.org
samba's umask is a little different to unix's umask
What do you suggest then?  I just want a wide open share on a private network.
errm, is this an open share (i.e. via guest) or do users need to authenticate themselves to logon to it?
if everyone logs on as guest, i cant see why you are having problems .. are you saying guest cant even change his own files?
no, gues can, but if the user on the ubuntu box makes, or saves changes to, a file, then the others can't access it except for read only.
ok, it's a ownership issue .. you need to have the guest account and the user in the same group and ensure that the group has write access over the files . it should be ok then
I think like you said earlier that it's got to do with samba's umask.  I forgot that I have OReilly's SAMBA book, and I think I foun what I need in that.
well, the umask can help -- but if the user creates a file in that directory, he and his group own the file and guest wont have access to it (unless it is world readable/writable etc)
you could use something like crossover office (which is a wine offshoot)
what is wrong with wine anyway?
i just tend to change the UA strings on firefox to masquerade as IE -- and most sites work fine
